result.execSummary:
The defendant Angela Marie Edwards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample; pay related surcharge. Pay court costs and victim/witness surcharges by 01-04-2021; to be paid out of up to 25% of prison accounts; non-payment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Angela Marie Edwards in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Angela Marie Edwards in custody.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant sworn under oath.  Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his/her plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

 The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 6 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence with credit for 6 days time served.  
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by January 4, 2021; to be paid out of up to 25% of prison accounts; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment; the 10% surcharge shall be waived; the 5% surcharge will not be waived.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by January 4, 2021; to be paid out of up to 25% of prison accounts; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-6 month drivers license suspension
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Attorney Gary E. Rosenthal in court, defendant Angela Marie Edwards not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
The State does not have their file for one of the cases. Case rescheduled for PLEA and SENTENCING on 1/2/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Attorney Bridget J. Krause in court, defendant Angela Marie Edwards not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case held off the record. Parties address the Court regarding other pending cases. Court has no objection to a global resolution. Case is adjourned for Status Conference on 12-23-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for December 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Intensive Supervision. Court orders GPS monitoring, 24 HOUR CURFEW, no exceptions. The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed, no alcohol.  No possession of any drug parapharnelia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering, or distributing. No possession of any firearm or firearm ammunition. Defendant may not possess more than $100 in cash at one time, including bills or coins. Defendant may not have contact with any co-defendant listed with case 14CF4528. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Attorney Gary E. Rosenthal in court, defendant Angela Marie Edwards not in court, in custody.  Paul Hauer for Brandon A. Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Return on Warrant. 
Bail is addressed. Arguments heard. Court sets cash bail.
Defense requests case be set for Scheduling Conference. Court orders case adjourned for Scheduling Conference on 11-25-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Angela Marie Edwards in court with attorney Barb Due for Bridget J. Krause.  Antoni Apollo for Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
As of August 3, 2014 due to judicial rotation this case is reassigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
